title: Danish queen says will abdicate on January 14
description: Citing her age and health issues, Queen Margrethe made the announcement during her traditional New Year's Eve speech broadcast on Danish television.

title: The 'American dream' of the growing number of Indians illegally migrating to the US
description: On December 21, a plane carrying some 300 Indian passengers was grounded in France on suspicion of illegal immigration. The incident highlights the spectacular increase in illegal emigration to the US.

title: DR Congo leader Tshisekedi wins second term in already contested election
description: The scale of the African president's victory is crushing – garnering about 73% of the ballots cast. The political opposition has made allegations that voting irregularities explain the huge margin.

title: 'Jacques Delors and the Parti Socialiste: A troubled relationship'
description: Historian Mathieu Fulla recalls that the former European Commission president, who died on December 27, had long favored forms of activism other than politics, only joining the Parti Socialiste in 1974.

title: Ukrainians face prospect of extended conscription: 'One day or another, we'll all have to go'
description: On December 19, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced the likely mobilization of almost 500,000 new recruits, even though thousands of soldiers have not been relieved in 22 months. But with the war bogged down, momentum has waned, and the first cracks have appeared in the population.

title: Arrival of British warship in Guyana rekindles tensions between UK and Venezuela
description: In response to the presence of the Royal Navy vessel, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has deployed new troops to the border of Essequibo, a Guyanese territory claimed by Caracas.

title: Le Monde's favorite films of 2023
description: Four filmmakers – Catherine Breillat, Steven Spielberg, Todd Field and Justine Triet – top the lists from our seven film critics for this year's retrospective.

title: Xi says China will 'surely be reunified' with self-ruled Taiwan in New Year's address
description: Taiwan split from China amid civil war in 1949, but Beijing continues to regard the island of 23 million with its high-tech economy as Chinese territory and has been ramping up its threat to achieve that by military force if necessary.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #2 Germany's meandering Moselle
description: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 2: Germany's Moselle Valley.

title: Fractures in Hollywood over Israel-Hamas conflict
description: Since the Hamas attack on Israel on October 7, a debate has been raging between staunch supporters of Israel and those who condemn the bombardments in Gaza. The divide reveals the sociological and ideological changes underway in Hollywood.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Arab human rights defenders sanctioned by Western donors
description: Civil society organizations in several Middle Eastern countries have lost European funding after condemning the Israeli offensive in Gaza. Their leaders criticize the censorship that weakens them in the face of the authoritarian regimes they oppose.

title: Moroccan political and business leaders caught up in international drug trafficking case
description: Twenty individuals, including the president of the country's most successful football club and a regional president, have been placed into custody in Casablanca.

title: In 2024, the risk of a recession looms in the wake of inflation
description: The number-one risk for the economy will be... geopolitics. The aftermath of Russia's war in Ukraine, potential escalation of the Israel-Hamas conflict and persistent unrest in the Red Sea region will weigh heavily in the economic equation.

title: North Korea dismisses any reconciliation with the South
description: Kim Jong Un additionally said that his country will launch three additional military spy satellites, build more nuclear weapons and introduce modern unmanned combat equipment in 2024.

title: From Minecraft to Roblox, children's favorite games have become havens for hackers
description: The immense popularity of these online games and their highly-developed ecosystems make them a prime target for scams and hacking campaigns. They also act as a testing ground for budding hackers.
